array.string: The first true primates evolved near the beginning of the Eocene Epoch. Their fossils have been found in North America, Europe, and Asia. They looked different from the primates today.
The gorillas were separated from the other hominids. With the extinction of other great apes, gorillas became the largest primates in the world.
Orrorin tugenensis, oldest human ancestor thought to have walked on two legs
Ardipithecus, early “proto-human” shares traits with chimps and gorillas, and is forest-dwelling
Australopithecines appear. They have brains no larger than a chimpanzee’s – with a volume around 400 – 500 cm3 -, but walk upright on two legs. First human ancestors to live on the savannah
Lucy, famous specimen of Australopithecus afarensis, lived near what is now Hadar, Ethiopia
